alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued May 29 at 9:50AM PDT until May 29 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE MCKINNEY AND MOUNTAIN BURN SCARS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the McKinney and Mountain Burn Scars. * WHERE...In the vicinity of the McKinney and Mountain Burn Scars is central and western Siskiyou County. This includes portions of highway 96. * WHEN...From 2 PM PDT this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall from slow moving storms is possible over the McKinney and Mountain Burn Scars during the period of the watch. People living, traveling, or recreating near the burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Significant runoff may cause flooding of creeks and streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
